item.title: allele
item.description: dominant or recessive

item.title: bacterial STD
item.description: [[Gonorrhea]]

item.title: caul
item.description: [!fail] This page does not exist (yet)!

item.title: clitoris
item.description: [!info] This page does not exist (yet)!

item.title: corpus spongiosum
item.description: creates the glans (end of penis) and is covered with foreskin richest in nerves (mechanoreceptors) circumcision → prevents infections, inflammations, and cancer

item.title: dihybrid cross
item.description: the inheritance of two different traits controlled by two different genes [!info] Labrador retrievers’ fur color relationship of 2 genes with dominant-recessive inheritance

item.title: DNA
item.description: [!fail] This page does not exist (yet)!

item.title: epididymis
item.description: place of [[sperm]] maturation and storage back surface of testicles

item.title: epistasis
item.description: type of genetic interaction where the phenotype is dependent on the presence or absence of one or more other genes

item.title: expulsion stage
item.description: contractions of the [[uterus]] and intentional abdominal push helps the baby to be born

item.title: fallopian tubes
item.description: connect [[ovaries]] to [[uterus]] fertilization happens in the upper ⅓

item.title: gamete
item.description: [[sperm]] or egg cells → contain half of genetic information

item.title: genes
item.description: segment of [[DNA]] that encodes for a functional [[RNA]] or protein product, which determines the traits and characteristics of living organisms

item.title: genetics
item.description: [[genes]] interact to create traits → [[epistasis]] an offspring inherits a [[genotype]] from parents’ [[gamete|gametes]]

item.title: genotype
item.description: the genetic background of a [[phenotype]] or other characteristic of an organism

item.title: gonads
item.description: produce [[sperm]] and ova ([[ovaries]] in females, [[testicles]] in males)

item.title: Gonorrhea
item.description: may be without symptoms inflammation in vagina and urethra

item.title: Grouping of reproductive organs
item.description: External reproductive organs Males [[penis]] [[scrotum]] Females [[vaginal opening]] [[labia]] [[clitoris]] Internal reproductive organs Males 2 [[testicles]] 2 [[epididymis]] 2 [[vas deferenses]] 2 [[seminal vesicles]] [[prostate gland]] Females 2 [[ovaries]] 2 [[fallopian tubes]] / uterine tubes [[uterus]] [[vagina]]

item.title: Human reproductive system
item.description: [!important] Aim is to pass on characteristics with genes Differences between male-female Primary sexual characteristics reproductive organs Secondary sexual characteristics (result of sex hormones)

item.title: implantation
item.description: embryo adheres to the endometrium → digs itself in

item.title: labia
item.description: [!info] This page does not exist (yet)!

item.title: ovaries
item.description: analogous to [[testicles]] 4x3x2cm [[gonads]] and endocrine glands too secretes estrogen and progesterone 500 eggs mature from 400 000

item.title: penis
item.description: copulatory organ to get [[sperm]] into the vagina 3 bodies with sinuses fill with blood and connective tissue (capsule) gives limit → hardening (erection)

item.title: phenotype
item.description: the observable physical or biochemical characteristics of an organism, resulting from the interaction of its [[genotype]] with the environment

item.title: Pregnancy
item.description: lasts 40 weeks (38 weeks from conception) Conception/fertilization in the oviduct (14th day of menstrual cycle) the zygote dicides and travels a week into the uterus → begins [[implantation]]

item.title: prostate gland
item.description: under the bladder produce 25-28% of semen causes the semen’s alkaline pH (activates [[sperm]]) [!important] Components of semen unite in the prostate gland

item.title: RNA
item.description: [!fail] This page does not exist (yet)!

item.title: scrotum
item.description: equals with the female [[labia]] regulates the temperature of [[testicles]] [[sperm]] cells need 34°C for maturation

item.title: seminal vesicles
item.description: glands behind the bladder produce 70% of semen Seminal fluid contains… proteins, enzymes, vitamins, fructose (E for sperms)

item.title: sex linked inheritance
item.description: refers to traits inherited through the [[X chromosome]] [!info] Calico cats’ fur [[genotype|Genotypes]] black male: $X^{b}Y$ orange male: $X^{B}Y$

item.title: sexually transmitted diseases
item.description: infections transmitted through sexual intercourse [!important] Micro ruptures diseases enter bloodstream through micro ruptures that open during intercourse

item.title: sperm
item.description: [!fail] This page does not exist (yet)!

item.title: Summary_Human reproduction
item.description: Name the parts of the female reproductive system on the diagram! (8p) Name the parts of the male reproductive system!

item.title: testicles
item.description: equal with female ovaries [[gonads]] and endocrine glands → produce 200-300 million immature [[sperm]] cells per day

item.title: umbilical cord
item.description: contains a thick artery and a vein

item.title: vagina

item.title: vas deferenses
item.description: store sperms during emission and pass them on
